citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process from 1:45 PM to 4:00
PM on 24SEP2024. After inspecting site 001 in Saginaw, I spoke to the licensee by phone at approximately 12:45 PM and
told him I intended to drive to the Lapeer location to verify the inventory. I stated that I could be there before 2:00 PM. The
licensee stated that someone would be there until that time. I arrived at 1:45 PM and knocked on the front door and rang
the bell on the back door of the facility. I received no response. I called and texted both numbers that I had for the
licensee with no response. I then called the store in Saginaw site 001. I spoke to an employee that said she would reach
out to the store manager as he was at lunch to see if he could contact the licensee. After about 20 minutes I called again
and the store manager was back at the Saginaw store. I was told by an employee that the licensee had no signal on his
phone and could not receive texts or calls and that the store manager had contacted the licensee using IM. I was told to
try to text again and I did with no response from the licensee. I decided to wait longer as I was told by the employee at site
001 that someone was supposed to be at the store to pick the parakeets and rabbits up for transfer to Saginaw. I waited
until 4:00 PM. I attempted to call the Saginaw store twice with no response. I then left to return home. Failure to provide
access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to
comply may result in enforcement action.
End Section

narrative:
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process from 1:45 PM to 4:00 
PM on 24SEP2024. After inspecting site 001 in Saginaw, I spoke to the licensee by phone at approximately 12:45 PM and 
told him I intended to drive to the Lapeer location to verify the inventory. I stated that I could be there before 2:00 PM. The 
licensee stated that someone would be there until that time. I arrived at 1:45 PM and knocked on the front door and rang 
the bell on the back door of the facility. I received no response. I called and texted both numbers that I had for the 
licensee with no response. I then called the store in Saginaw site 001. I spoke to an employee that said she would reach 
out to the store manager as he was at lunch to see if he could contact the licensee. After about 20 minutes I called again 
and the store manager was back at the Saginaw store. I was told by an employee that the licensee had no signal on his 
phone and could not receive texts or calls and that the store manager had contacted the licensee using IM. I was told to 
try to text again and I did with no response from the licensee. I decided to wait longer as I was told by the employee at site 
001 that someone was supposed to be at the store to pick the parakeets and rabbits up for transfer to Saginaw. I waited 
until 4:00 PM. I attempted to call the Saginaw store twice with no response. I then left to return home. Failure to provide 
access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to 
comply may result in enforcement action. 
 
 
End Section
